page.title: 01THE AREA SURVEYED
page.content: The area covered by our survey includes the town lands of Cardonaghy, Moyasset, Moneydollog, Corbally, Fenaghy, Galgorm, Killane and Lisnifillon. This is a rural area in the valley of the River Main. The land is low lying mostly less than 120 metres high with farming as the main activity. Some of the houses in the area, for example, Fenaghy House and Corbally House are of historical and architectural interest. There is a riding school for the disabled. Less than 10% of our area is taken up by the Village of Galgorm and its Industrial Estate. The area is crossed by mainly B class and minor roads and the Ballymena to Cullybacky section of the Belfast to Londonderry railway line cuts across the North-East corner of the area.
